paper_title: The jet apparent motion and central engine study of Fermi blazars
abstract: The study of blazar jet has been performed for several decades via the VLBI technique, while its generation and propagation stay unclear. In the present work, we compiled a sample of 407 VLBI detected \textit{Fermi} blazars (VFBs) and studied the correlations between apparent velocity (${\rm log}\,β_{\rm app}$) and jet/accretion disk properties. We found a positive correlation between $γ$-ray luminosity (${\rm log}\,L_{\rm γ}$) and ${\rm log}\,β_{\rm app}$, the correlation suggests that the apparent motion of jet knot is related to the jet power.
